div.a: UPDATED APRIL 20: School Lunch sites during school closure

br.span: Newark City Schools will be offering grab-and-go breakfast and lunch packs from more than 20 locations across Newark. The meals will be available from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. every weekday. Please click here for a list of locations, organized by school attendance area. Families can visit any spot that is most convenient. The sites were updated on April 20. We are no longer serving meals at the following locations: Liberty Middle School, the Maintenance and Transportation Warehouse, White Field, the Administration Service Center, the Skate Park or Don Edwards, due to low demand.

div.a: NCS hosting virtual 5K to raise money for United Way

span.div: Put on your sneakers, Cats! Newark City Schools staff and families are invited to the #wildcats_united 5K to raise money for those affected by COVID19 in Licking County, Ohio. Participants are encouraged to donate an anonymous amount of their choosing, and complete a 3-mile (or 3.1 for a 5K!) walk or jog between April 28-30. This is 3 Days, 3 Miles- however you opt to do your 5K is up to you! Donations can be made through Licking County United Way @ https://www.unitedwaylc.org/ Please register for the event on Facebook by clicking here.https://www.unitedwaylc.org/

The Newark City School District Board of Education recently invited the community to join them in their statewide superintendent search by filling out a questionnaire. A profile report has now been completed, compiling the results from the questionnaire. That report is available by clicking on this link. The profile report will be used as a recruiting tool and to develop questions for candidate interviews.

img.title: NCS Logo
img.alt: New student registration update for 2020-21 school year

div.a: New student registration update for 2020-21 school year

br.span: Due to the ongoing regulations surrounding COVID-19, NCS is not currently finalizing registrations for the 2020-21 school year. This is for incoming kindergarten through 12th grade students. The online forms system is still available, and parents can fill forms out at any time. We will not be making appointments to finalize your student's registration until a later time — at least after May 1, if not later. Student registration for the current school year (2019-20) is still available. Please visit our student registration page by clicking here.

The blended learning homepage is now live on our website. Students and families can visit the Blended Learning page to find links to lessons for grades Pre K-5. Online classroom codes for middle and high school are also available on the page. Information will be added to these pages throughout the current school closure. Please bookmark the following link: Blended Learning. This is the page were students can find assignments, which will be posted on a weekly basis in grade Pre-K through 5.

It has been a wonderful first week of blended learning in the Newark City School District. Earlier this week, Governor DeWine extended the school closure and stay-at-home order to May 1. Our goal as a district during this time is to help students learn from home without overwhelming families. We know that this is a stressful time, and we don’t want to add to that stress level. If you need additional support, please reach out to your child’s teacher or additional contacts that you may have. We have technical support numbers available on our website’s Blended Learning page, as well.

div.span: May

a.title:
The Newark City Schools Board of Education meets usually on the 2nd Monday of every month in the Administrative Service Center, Room 151, at the former Roosevelt Middle School, 621 Mount Vernon Road, Newark.
 
In 2020, the board will meet on the 1st Monday in February and the 3rd Monday in November. Meetings will be held on the 2nd Monday every other month. 
Location: Administrative Service Center, Room 151 Starting at: 6:30 PM
